entry.title: Systemd unit for managing USB gadgets
entry.author: Lars Kellogg-Stedman
entry.summary: The Pi Zero (and Zero W) have support for acting as a USB gadget: that means that they can be configured to act as a USB device – like a serial port, an ethernet interface, a mass storage device, etc. There are two different ways of configuring this support. The first only allows you to configure a single type of gadget at a time, and boils down to: Enable the dwc2 overlay in /boot/config.
